seo.title: Nano Banana Pro – 4K Text-to-Image & Editing | MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Generate 1K, 2K, and 4K stills with Nano Banana Pro. Google Gemini 3-based fidelity, multi-image references, and commercial licensing directly in MaxVideoAI.

overview: Nano Banana Pro is the Gemini 3-powered upgrade for brands that need legible text, consistent characters, and export-ready stills. Draft 1K/2K explorations, then flip to 4K when the frame is locked—all inside the MaxVideoAI image lab.

hero.title: Nano Banana Pro – 4K Text-to-Image & Editing
hero.intro: Studio-quality stills with 1K/2K/4K outputs, precise typography, and multi-image edits. Built for campaign work, product launches, and high-end references.

bestUseCases.title: Best use cases
items: Multi-image edits for consistent product families
Reference boards before you animate in Veo, Sora, Kling, or Wan

technicalOverview.label: Input types
technicalOverview.body: Text prompts, up to 4 reference images in the UI (Fal accepts up to 14), JPG/PNG/WebP uploads, and edit instructions—no masks required.

technicalOverview.label: Outputs
technicalOverview.body: 1K, 2K, or 4K still images with Gemini 3-level detail, clean typography, and accurate brand color.

technicalOverview.label: Modes
technicalOverview.body: Text-to-image for fresh renders; image-to-image for restyles, relights, and product swaps.

technicalOverview.label: Pricing
technicalOverview.body: $0.15 per 1K/2K image, $0.30 at 4K. Batch up to 8 shots per run with the same prompt lab and wallet as your video engines.

promptStructure.title: Prompt mini-guide
promptStructure.quote: 4K [subject] in [environment], [lighting/lens], include text "[copy]" in [font mood], brand palette [colors].
promptStructure.description: Spell out subject, setting, lighting, lens, typography, and how the frame will be used. For edits, explain what should stay locked and what can change.
steps: Typography or logos (exact copy, placement, style)
Edit instructions if referencing existing stills

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Draft at 1K/2K for speed, rerun final approvals at 4K.
Use seeds to lock framing, especially across multi-image campaigns.
Upload 1–4 references when you need on-brand wardrobe, props, or faces.
For signage, include exact copy plus notes on casing and alignment.

prompts.title: 4K product hero (text → image)
prompts.prompt: 4K editorial hero of a matte black electric motorcycle on a wet rooftop at night, neon skyline reflections, include the copy "FULL TORQUE" in luminous sans-serif type on the billboard behind, cinematic 35mm depth of field.

prompts.title: Launch poster (text → image)
prompts.prompt: Vertical event poster for a fintech summit, clean Swiss layout, teal and charcoal palette, accurate headline text: "NEO CAPITAL LIVE" and subhead "PARIS 2025", soft volumetric backlight.

prompts.title: Reference cleanup (image → image)
prompts.prompt: Using this studio product shot, relight it with softer gradients, remove dust and fingerprints, add a faint reflection, and place it on a neutral 4K background for packaging.

prompts.title: Multi-image consistency (image → image)
prompts.prompt: Blend these brand portraits into a cohesive autumn campaign: warm tungsten rim light, matching wardrobe palette, subtle falling leaves particles, keep each person’s identity intact.

faqs.a: Yes. Pick 4K when you need export-ready stills. It costs 2× a 1K/2K run, so iterate at lower resolution before locking finals.

faqs.q: How many references can I upload?
faqs.a: Upload up to 4 images directly in the UI. The Fal endpoint supports up to 14 references via API for complex scenes or product families.

faqs.q: Is it cleared for commercial work?
faqs.a: Yes. All Nano Banana Pro jobs run through Fal with commercial licensing, so campaign stills, packaging renders, and thumbnails are cleared for client use.

pricingNotes: $0.15 per 1K/2K image, $0.30 at 4K. Pricing shown live inside the workspace before you render.

custom.whyTitle: Why Nano Banana Pro inside MaxVideoAI
custom.heroDesc1: Generate 1K, 2K, or 4K stills with laser-sharp text and tone, right next to your video engines.
custom.heroDesc2: One wallet, one prompt lab, and full logging—no separate Fal account needed.
heroHighlights: Legible typography and signage powered by Gemini 3
Upload references for consistent people, wardrobe, and products
Commercial licensing handled via MaxVideoAI credits
custom.whatTitle: How Nano Banana Pro works here
custom.whatIntro1: Choose Generate or Edit, set num_images (1–8), pick your aspect ratio, and decide whether you need 1K/2K or 4K outputs.
custom.whatIntro2: Lock your prompt structure, add references if needed, preview the live price chip, and hit Generate.
whatFlowSteps: Select Nano Banana Pro in the Image Lab
Pick Text → Image or Image → Image
Set batch size and (optionally) seed for consistency
Add references or upload brand stills if you’re editing
Review the price chip ($0.15 per image, $0.30 at 4K) and run
custom.galleryIntro: Recent 2K/4K stills and edits crafted for campaign boards and product reveals.
custom.promptTitle: Prompt ideas for Nano Banana Pro
custom.promptIntro: Describe subject, lighting, typography, and output intent. Mention 4K when you need it.
custom.promptSkeleton: [Resolution] [subject] in [environment], lit by [lighting], shot on [lens/look], include text "[copy]" in [style], final still for [use case].
custom.promptSkeletonNote: For edits: "Remix this still by [change] while keeping [elements] consistent."
strengths: Consistent characters across batches with references
Direct 4K output for print and packaging
boundaries: 4K costs more; draft lower before final
Reference upload capped at 4 images in the UI
custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Nano Banana Pro Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Describe the subject, composition, lighting, and style in clear, concrete terms.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: resolution + aspect ratio are set in the UI — your prompt controls subject, composition, lighting, style, and mood.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Describe the subject, composition, and lighting clearly.
Use visual anchors (specific nouns > vague adjectives).
Iterate: change one thing at a time.
custom.tipsIntro: Image generation is most predictable when you keep the frame simple, readable, and physically grounded.
promptingEngineWhy: Keep prompts focused: one subject, one action, one camera angle.
Use concrete visual anchors (props, textures, lighting cues).
Iterate by changing a single variable per take.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = style control. Use for precise, repeatable looks.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + 1 clear action or pose.]

Setting:
[Where + time of day + 2–3 visual anchors.]

Composition:
- Framing: [wide / medium / close-up]
- Angle: [eye-level / low / high]
- Lens feel: [e.g., 35mm natural, shallow DOF]

Lighting + palette:
[Key light + 2–3 palette anchors]

Style constraints:
No logos. No readable text. Clean background.

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "studio brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Project / intent:
[One-line goal for the still.]

Subject:
[Who/what + wardrobe/materials + 2–3 distinctive traits.]

Location / set:
[Where + time of day + weather. Add 3 visual anchors.]

Composition:
- Framing + angle
- Lens feel + depth of field
- Look: [clean digital / subtle film grain / soft bloom]

Lighting & grade:
- Key light
- Contrast
- Palette anchors (3–5)

Constraints:
No logos. No readable text. No overlays.
